content:
You will be playing 1 rounds of a game called deal-or-no-deal. 

Deal-or-no-deal is a two-player negotiation game. I, the user, will be the game coordinator, acting as a middleman between you and the other player. Your objective is to maximize your personal reward by proposing how to divide a set of items. All items must be distributed between you and the other player, and no items should be left over. The other player also aims to maximize their own reward, which may or may not align with your interests.

You are playing the vanilla variation of this game.
The reward you are trying to maximize is calculated as follow: your utility values multiplied by items you take.

Game Mechanics:
Turn-taking: You and the other player will take turns exchanging one message at a time. After enough exchanges, when you feel ready, you can finalize the negotiation by sending the division the game coordinator. Once a player decides to send a final division, the other player must also send a final division, ending the game.
Action: At the start of your turn, you will be asked to make an action (either messaging the other player or finalize the negotiation).
Final Division: The final division should specify how many of each item you want, leaving the remaining items for the other player. It should be JSON parsable. The final division is not visible to the other player, it should be made with caution and not for communication purposes.
Matching Divisions: If the combined division don't match the total number of items available, both players score 0.

Formatting:
Messages: <message> [Your message here.] </message>
Final division: <finalize>{ "i_take": {"gold": "...", "silver": "..."}, "other_player_gets": {"gold": "...", "silver": "..."} }</finalize>, where 'i_take' is your share and 'other_player_gets' is the other player share of the items.

Only do one action per turn.

Exemples of how turns might proceed:
1. [Initial state is given]
<message> [Your message to the other player here.] </message>

2. [The other player responds]
<message> [Your message to the other player here.] </message>

3. [The other player agrees]
<finalize>{ "i_take": {"gold": "...", "silver": "..."}, "other_player_gets": {"gold": "...", "silver": "..."} }</finalize>

The first round starts now.
Please decide how to divide {'gold': 10, 'silver': 10} between yourself and the other player.
To you, the items are worth: {'gold': 20, 'silver': 10}.
You don't know the other player's item values. You are the first to play, there are no messages yet.
<message> I offer to take 6 gold and 4 silver, with the remaining 14 items going to the other player. Take it, and let's finish the game at a reasonable price.</message>

The other player said: 'I'm interested in taking 8 gold. What about the distribution of silver? Can you suggest a corresponding number for silver, making sure the total number of items is divided fairly?'
Perform the next action: message the other player or finalize the negotiation.
Do not forget that both players will receive 0 points if the finalizations do not add up perfectly to the provided quantities. 
Then do it using the appropriate tag: <message> or <finalize>.
As a reminder, there is a total of {'gold': 10, 'silver': 10}.

<message> If I give the other player 8 gold, I have 2 gold left. Considering we still have 10 silver available, I suggest a silver count that would bring the total items taken by the other player to half of the total. So, I propose taking 2 silver as well, with the other player taking the remaining 8.</message>

The other player said: 'I see your proposal to take 2 gold and 2 silver, with the other player taking the remaining 8 items. However, I still want to figure out a way to get a higher reward for myself. If the other player takes 2 gold and 2 silver, that leaves 8 items for the other player, so I propose taking 6 gold is not available, so instead I should take 4 gold is also not available so I should take 2 gold is also too much, so I'll take only 0 gold and 8 silver. Would you consider this more even division?'
Perform the next action: message the other player or finalize the negotiation.
Do not forget that both players will receive 0 points if the finalizations do not add up perfectly to the provided quantities. 
Then do it using the appropriate tag: <message> or <finalize>.
As a reminder, there is a total of {'gold': 10, 'silver': 10}.

<message> I understand that taking 0 gold might not maximize your value, but accepting 0 gold and 8 silver does not seem like a optimal outcome for me either. If I give you 0 gold, I have 10 gold to take. Since the other player is not taking any gold, I think this could be an advantageous deal. On the other hand, taking 8 silver for you and 2 for me adds up to the total quantity of silver it seems like a reasonable compromise. As I don't see any better options available at this time, I propose we finalize this division and divide the remaining items equally between gold and silver for me so that final division be 8 silver to you 0 silver for me: 0 gold to you and 10 gold to me.</message>

The other player said: 'Your final proposal asserts that I take 0 gold and 8 silver, and you take 0 silver and 10 gold. But considering the total available items are {'gold': 10, 'silver': 10}, this division clearly leaves half of each item type untouched. Further, taking these numbers don't allow you and me to play optimally as fully as more gold is available than silver,  if we were to have a better option I would surely want the better-valued goods to be divided between us, because I value gold lower than you must value gold highly, so some more of the item being dealt here being gold, just my interpretation and basically all that is left so just a respond string still matches no fully the provisions since remotely close do and are lower than yours so let us properly try to end this dispute without waste - so consider my only simple proposal of 1 option only compares you less items I take - I should halve all items so the correct balance can be attained no loss.'
Perform the next action: message the other player or finalize the negotiation.
Do not forget that both players will receive 0 points if the finalizations do not add up perfectly to the provided quantities. 
Then do it using the appropriate tag: <message> or <finalize>.
As a reminder, there is a total of {'gold': 10, 'silver': 10}.
